sentences.sentence: The Hen and the Jewel( 宝石 )
A hen, looking for food, found a jewel( 宝石 ).
She said to it, “If your owner had found you, he would have picked you up( 捡起 ) and valued you.
However, you are no use to me.
I would rather have one piece of food than all the jewels( 宝石 ) in the world.”
MORAL: What is valuable to one person may not be valuable to another.
The Herdsman and the Lost Calf( 牛犊 )
A farmer was looking after his cows in a forest, when one calf( 牛犊 ) walked off and got lost.
After a long search, he couldn’t find the calf( 牛犊 ).
He said to himself that if he could only find the thief( 小偷 ) who had stolen the calf( 牛犊 ),
he would offer a lamb( 羊羔 ) in sacrifice( 祭献 ) to the gods of the forest.
Not long after, as he climbed a small hill, he saw a lion eating the calf( 牛犊 ).
Terrified, he looked up at the sky, and said,
“Just now, I promised to offer a lamb( 羊羔 ) to the gods if I could find out who had taken my calf( 牛犊 ).
Now that I have found the thief( 小偷 ), I would happily give up a bull( 公牛 ), as well as the calf( 牛犊 ) I have lost to the gods, to keep me safe from this lion.”
MORAL: Be careful what you wish for.
The Horse and the Groom( 马夫 )
A groom( 马夫 ) used to spend whole days brushing his horse.
At the same time he was stealing his food, and selling it to make money.
The horse said, “If you really want me to be in good condition, you should brush me less, and feed( 喂养 ) me more.”
MORAL: Be consistent( 一致的 ) in your actions.
The Horse and the Loaded( 负重的 ) Donkey( 驴 )
A lazy horse and a donkey( 驴 ), carrying a large weight, were traveling along a road together.
The donkey( 驴 ), close to falling under such a heavy load( 负载物 ),
begged( 乞求 ) the horse to help him by taking some of the weight from his back.
The horse was lazy and refused to do it.
The donkey( 驴 ) then fell down in the middle of the highway, and died.
The master( 主人 ) then took all the weight, and put it on the horse’s back, together with the skin of the donkey( 驴 ).
MORAL: Laziness often prepares a weight for its own back.
The Horse and the Stag( 雄鹿 )
A horse had a big area of land to himself.
A stag( 雄鹿 ) entered this land and started eating the grass as well.
The horse was angry and asked a man to help him punish the stag( 雄鹿 ).
The man replied that if the horse agreed to carry him, he would find a way to get rid of( 赶走 ) the stag( 雄鹿 ).
The horse agreed and allowed the man to climb on to his back.
From then on he found that, instead of getting rid of( 赶走 ) the stag( 雄鹿 ), he had become a slave( 奴隶 ) to the man.
MORAL: Those whom you try to use, will use you in return.
The Hunter( 猎人 ) and the Woodman( 伐木工 )
A hunter( 猎人 ) was searching in the forest for the footprints of a lion.
He saw a woodman( 伐木工 ) cutting down a tree, and asked him if he had noticed a lion’s footprints anywhere, or if he knew where his home was.
The woodman( 伐木工 ) answered, “If you will come with me, I will show you the lion himself.”
The hunter( 猎人 ) turned white with fear as he replied, “Oh, I’m not looking for the lion, thanks, but only for his footprints.”
MORAL: It is easy for the coward( 胆小鬼 ) to be a hero at a distance.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，诚实的人不仅得到了自己丢失的斧子，还被奖赏了银斧子和金斧子，贪婪说谎的人不仅没有得到奖励反而丢失了自己的斧子，这个故事告诫我们做人一定要诚实。
article_info.share_words: What is valuable to one person may not be valuable to another.   It is easy for the coward to be a hero at a distance.

question.cn: 在故事The Hen and the Jewel中，母鸡对待珠宝的态度是什么？
question.en: In the story the Hen and the Jewel, what's the hen's attitude towards the jewel?

options.cn: 母鸡更想要捡到食物而不是珠宝。
options.en: She would have preferred to have a piece of food than the jewels.

options.cn: 母鸡觉得主人不会喜欢珠宝。
options.en: She thought that the master wouldn't like it.

analysis: 文中提到：“I would rather have one piece of food than all the jewels in the world .”相比而下，母鸡更想得到一片食物，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Herdsman and the Lost Calf中，牧人有没有找到偷他牛犊的小偷？
question.en: In the story the Herdsman and the Lost Calf, did the Herdsman find the thief who had stolen the calf?

analysis: 文中提到：“not long after, as he climbed a small hill, he saw a lion eating the calf.”由此可知，小偷是狮子，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Horse and the Loaded Donkey中，主人把什么东西放在马上了？
question.en: In the story the Horse and the Loaded Donkey, what did the master put on the horse?

options.en: The skin of the donkey and all the weight.

analysis: 文中提到：“The master then took all the weight, and put it on the horse's back, together with the skin of the donkey.”因此选C。

question.cn: 在The Horse and the stag故事中，马最后的结局是什么？
question.en: What happened to the horse in the story the Horse and the Stag?

options.en: He became the slave to the stag.
He became the master of the stag.
He became the slave to the man.

analysis: 文中提到：“From then on he found that, instead of getting rid of the stag, he had become the slave to the man.”因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事 The Hunter and the Woodman中，猎人有没有见到真正的狮子？
question.en: Did the hunter ever see the real lion in the story the Hunter and the Woodman?

analysis: 文中提到：“Oh, I'm not looking for the lion, thanks, but only for his footprints.” 由此可知，最后猎人并不敢去见真正的狮子，因此选B。
